#summary opcodes for floaitng point instructions

=== Floating Point Instructions ===

==== FADD ====
Template opcode:
{{{
0000 000000 1110 xxxxxx xxxxxx xxxxxx xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx 001010
}}}

Instruction Usage:
{{{
FADD Rxx, Rxx, (-)Rxx/(-)c[0xa][0xb]/F(-)123.123/0xabcd;
}}}
If the third operand is a floating point number, it will be a 32-bit floaitng point number with the last 12 bits truncated.

==== FSETP ====
Template opcode:
{{{
1100 010000 1110 111 000 000000 0000000000000000000000 0 1110 000000 11000
                   p  |p    re1                   comp    opp   mod2
p: destination predicate register
|p: negate of p
opp: fifth operand of a SETP instruction. Please refer to ptx manual for its meaning.
comp: see the imme section of the Opcode page
mod2 0:3 specifies the comparator
	1: .LT
	2: .EQ
	3: .LE
	4: .GT
	5: .NE
	6: .GE
	7: .NUM
	8: .NAN
	9: .LTU
	10:.EQU
	11:.LEU
	12:.GTU
	14:.GEU
mod2 4:5 specifies the logical operation done with opp
	0: .AND
	1: .OR
	2: .XOR
}}}
Instruction usage:
{{{
FSETP.comparator(.logical op) p (,|p), register, regitser/constant memory/20-bit immediate (,opp)
}}}
